xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This is a library module offering the same set of functions defined by Microsoft Excel, under Text and Data Functions.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: Sorin Nasoi

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Import excel-math module functions.
Returns the union of the values in two sequences in an implementation-defined order. It removes duplicates.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The union of the values in two sequences in an implementation-defined order. It removes duplicates.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:value-union
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-text:value-union($arg1 as xs:anyAtomicType*, $arg2 as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the intersection of the values in two sequences in an implementation-defined order. It removes duplicates.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The intersection of the values in two sequences in an implementation-defined order. It removes duplicates.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:value-intersect
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-text:value-intersect($arg1 as xs:anyAtomicType*, $arg2 as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the values in one sequence that do not appear in the second sequence in an implementation-defined order.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The values in one sequence that do not appear in the second sequence in an implementation-defined order.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:value-except
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:value-except($arg1 as xs:anyAtomicType*, $arg2 as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Reverses the order of characters in a string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Reverses the order of characters in a string or zero-length string if the argument is the empty sequence.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:reverse-string
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-text:reverse-string($arg as xs:string?) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns $string appended with enough repetitions of $padChar to make its length $length.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
$string appended with enough repetitions of $padChar to make its length $length.
The $string is trunctated if it's length is greater than $length.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:pad-string-to-length
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-text:pad-string-to-length($string as xs:string?, $padChar as xs:string, $length as xs:integer) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns $toPad appended with enough repetitions of $padChar to make its length $length, the characters are added before the string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: $toPad appended with enough repetitions of $padChar to make its length $length, the characters are added before the string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if the length of the $toPad is greater than the desired length.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:pad-integer-to-length
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:pad-integer-to-length($toPad as xs:anyAtomicType?, $padChar as xs:string, $length as xs:integer) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an integer representing the first position of a substring that matches $pattern within $arg.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
An integer representing the first position of a substring that matches $pattern within $arg.
If $arg does not match $pattern, the empty sequence is returned.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:index-of-match-first
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-text:index-of-match-first($arg as xs:string?, $pattern as xs:string) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an integer representing the first position of a substring that matches $pattern using $flags within $arg.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $flags options for the interpretation of the regular expression.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
An integer representing the first position of a substring that matches $pattern using $flags within $arg.
If $arg does not match $pattern, the empty sequence is returned.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:index-of-match-first
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-text:index-of-match-first($arg as xs:string?, $pattern as xs:string, $flags as xs:string) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns an integer representing the $instance_num position of a substring that matches $pattern within $arg starting from $pos.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $pos the position to start the search.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
An integer representing the $instance_num position of a substring that matches $pattern within $arg starting from $pos.
If $arg does not match $pattern, the empty sequence is returned.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:index-of-match
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-text:index-of-match($arg as xs:string?, $pattern as xs:string, $pos as xs:integer, $instance_num as xs:integer) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Splits $text in groups of $length characters starting from right to left.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Splits $text in groups of $length characters starting from right to left.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:tokenize-length
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-text:tokenize-length($text as xs:string, $length as xs:decimal) as xs:string*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the given $text unchanged.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The given $text unchanged.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:asc
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:asc($text as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the character specified by a certain codepoint.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the character specified by a certain codepoint.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value provided $number must be in range [1,255].

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:char
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:char($number as xs:integer) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a codepoint for the first character in a text string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: A codepoint for the first character in a text string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:code
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:code($arg as xs:string) as xs:integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Joins two text strings into one text string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Joins two text strings into one text string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:concatenate
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:concatenate($arg1 as xs:anyAtomicType?, $arg2 as xs:anyAtomicType?) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Joins several text strings into one text string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Joins several text strings into one text string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:concatenate
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:concatenate($args as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Removes all nonprintable characters from text.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
Removes all nonprintable characters from text. The CLEAN function was designed. to remove the first 32 nonprinting characters in the 7-bit ASCII code (values 0 through 31) from text.
In the Unicode character set, there are additional nonprinting characters (values 127, 129, 141, 143, 144, and 157).
By itself, the CLEAN function does not remove these additional nonprinting characters.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:clean
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:clean($arg as xs:string?) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number is the number you want to round and convert to text.
$decimals is the number of digits to the right of the decimal point.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:fixed
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:fixed($number as xs:decimal, $decimals as xs:decimal) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $number is the number you want to round and convert to text.
$decimals is the number of digits to the right of the decimal point.
$no_commas is a logical value that, if TRUE, prevents FIXED from including commas in the returned text.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:fixed
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:fixed($number as xs:decimal, $decimals as xs:decimal, $no_commas as xs:boolean) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol. The number of digits to the right of the decimal point is 2.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol. The number of digits to the right of the decimal point is 2.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:dollar
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:dollar($number as xs:decimal) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param:
$decimals is the number of digits to the right of the decimal point.
If decimals is negative, number is rounded to the left of the decimal point.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:dollar
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:dollar($number as xs:decimal, $decimals as xs:decimal) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Compares two text strings and returns TRUE if they are exactly the same, FALSE otherwise. EXACT is case-sensitive but ignores formatting differences.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Compares two text strings and returns TRUE if they are exactly the same, FALSE otherwise. EXACT is case-sensitive but ignores formatting differences.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:exact
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:exact($arg1 as xs:string, $arg2 as xs:string) as xs:boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the first character in a text string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg is the text string that contains the characters you want to extract.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The first character in a text string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:left
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:left($arg as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the first character or characters in $text, based on the number of $num_chars you specify.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $text is the text string that contains the characters you want to extract.
$num_chars specifies the number of characters you want to extract.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The first character or characters in $text, based on the number of $num_chars you specify.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:left
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:left($text as xs:string, $num_chars as xs:integer) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the number of characters in a text string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The number of characters in a text string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:len
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:len($arg as xs:string?) as xs:integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts all uppercase letters in a text string to lowercase.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Converts all uppercase letters in a text string to lowercase.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:lower
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:lower($arg as xs:string?) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns a specific number of characters from a text string, starting at the position you specify, based on the number of characters you specify.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $text the text string containing the characters you want to extract.
$start_num the position of the first character you want to extract in text. The first character in text has start_num 1, and so on.
$num_chars the number of characters you want to return from text.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: A specific number of characters from a text string, starting at the position you specify, based on the number of characters you specify.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:mid
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:mid($text as xs:string?, $start_num as xs:integer, $num_chars as xs:integer) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Replaces part of a text string, based on the number of characters you specify, with a different text string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $old_text is text in which you want to replace some characters.
$start_num the position of the character in old_text that you want to replace with new_text.
$num_chars the number of characters in old_text that you want REPLACE to replace with new_text.
$new_text the text that will replace characters in old_text.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Replaces part of a text string, based on the number of characters you specify, with a different text string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:replace
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:replace($old_text as xs:string?, $start_num as xs:integer, $num_chars as xs:integer, $new_text as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the last character in a text string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $arg the text string containing the characters you want to extract.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The last character in a text string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:right
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:right($arg as xs:string) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the last character or characters in a text string, based on the number of characters you specify.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $text the text string containing the characters you want to extract.
$num_chars specifies the number of characters you want RIGHT to extract.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The last character or characters in a text string, based on the number of characters you specify.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:right
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:right($text as xs:string, $num_chars as xs:integer) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.
The search starts at position 1, and it is not case sensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $within_text text in which you want to search for $find_text.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.
The search starts at position 1, and it is not case sensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value the value is not greater than zero or is greater than the length of within_text.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:search
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:search($find_text as xs:string, $within_text as xs:string) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.
The search starts at $start_num, and it is not case sensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $within_text text in which you want to search for $find_text.
$start_num the character number in within_text at which you want to start searching.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.
The search starts at $start_num, and it is not case sensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value the value is not greater than zero or is greater than the length of within_text.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:search
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:search($find_text as xs:string, $within_text as xs:string, $start_num as xs:integer) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.
The search is case sensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $within_text text in which you want to search for $find_text.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.
The search is case sensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value the value is not greater than zero or is greater than the length of within_text.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:find
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:find($find_text as xs:string, $within_text as xs:string) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.
The search is case sensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $within_text text in which you want to search for $find_text.
$start_num specifies the character at which to start the search.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.
The search is case sensitive.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value the value is not greater than zero or is greater than the length of within_text.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:find
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:find($find_text as xs:string, $within_text as xs:string, $start_num as xs:integer) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $text the text or the reference to a cell containing text for which you want to substitute characters.
$new_text text you want to replace old_text with.

$instance_num specifies which occurrence of old_text you want to replace with new_text.
Only that instance of old_text is replaced.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string.
Use SUBSTITUTE when you want to replace specific text in a text string; use REPLACE when you want to replace any text that occurs in a specific location in a text string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:substitute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:substitute($text as xs:string, $old_text as xs:string, $new_text as xs:string, $instance_num as xs:integer?) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string. Every occurrence of old_text in text is changed to new_text.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $text the text or the reference to a cell containing text for which you want to substitute characters.
$new_text text you want to replace old_text with.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string. Every occurrence of old_text in text is changed to new_text.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:substitute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:substitute($text as xs:string, $old_text as xs:string, $new_text as xs:string) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Removes all spaces from text except for single spaces between words.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $text from which you want spaces removed.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Removes all spaces from text except for single spaces between words.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:trim
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:trim($text as xs:string?) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts text to uppercase.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $text text you want converted to uppercase.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Converts text to uppercase.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:upper
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:upper($text as xs:string?) as xs:string?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts the $value to string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Converts the $value to string.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:t
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:t($value as xs:anyAtomicType?) as xs:string

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Converts a text string that represents a number to a number.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: Converts a text string that represents a number to a number.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value provided value is not a number.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-text:value
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-text:value($arg as xs:anyAtomicType?) as xs:anyAtomicType?
